Title: Data Analyst - Account Management Operations (They/She/He)
Description:
If you’re here, it’s because you’re looking for an exciting ride.

A ride that will fuel up your ambitions to take on a new challenge and stretch yourself beyond your comfort zone.

We’ll deliver a non-vanilla culture built on talent, where we work to amplify the impact on millions of people, paving the way forward together.

Not your usual app. We are the fastest-growing multi-category app connecting millions of users with businesses, and couriers, offering on-demand services from more than 170,000 local restaurants, grocers and supermarkets, and high street retail stores. We operate in more than 1500 cities across 25 countries.

Together we revolutionize the way people connect with their everyday needs, from delivering essentials to connecting our ecosystem of users through innovative solutions powered by technology. For us, every day is filled with purpose.

What makes our ride unique?

🤝 Our culture and strong values.

💪 Our career development philosophy.

🤝 Our commitment to being a force for good.

We have a vision: To give everyone easy access to anything in their cities. And this is where your ride starts.

YOUR MISSION

In this role you will be part of the Account Management Team at Glovo Headquarters, that is focused on growing and retaining Glovo partners. You will be directly responsible for overseeing, challenging and rethinking the data, business plan & processes of the post-sales operational landscape, based on solid data driven conclusions, so that they can be implemented on a global scale.

THE JOURNEY


Stakeholder management: Partner closely with senior sales leaders and cross functional partners to align on strategy
Communication: find simple ways to convey insights and recommendations from sophisticated analysis results to business leaders.
Data Analysis: Utilize advanced data analysis techniques to interpret complex datasets; Analyze and report weekly and monthly metrics to identify trends and stop opportunities for improvement.
Process Optimization: leverage data analysis to analyze Account Management processes and lead the implementation of optimization strategies to drive efficiency and effectiveness in sales operations.
Automation: Design and implement automation solutions to remove manual processes.
Planning: Partner with Account Management leadership to set performance targets for local teams, recommend actions for improvement and work together to integrate positive changes within the operational environment.


What You Will Bring To The Ride


Bachelor in Economics, Mathematics, Statistics or Engineering preferred.
4 years of work experience, outside of an academic and internship setting, in a quantitative analysis role, preferably with 2 years in Sales Operations.
Mastery in SQL and statistical programming (Python/R) and experience working with analytics/ds libraries such as Pandas, SciPy, Seaborn, Jupyter/iPython notebooks, R Markdown
In-depth knowledge of BI tools such as Looker, Tableau, and practical experience analyzing data, program metrics, and performance
Ability to summarize and represent data (e.g., descriptive statistics and graphs).
Ability to create robust, insightful, and story-telling visualizations using modern BI & Analytics tools and ability to identify data Issues.
Familiarity with a collaborative environment and/or version control (GitHub, Git).
Ability to build hypotheses and test them (sometimes by piloting projects entirely)
Project management / coordination skills. Determined to get things done
Understanding of A/B test principles, to design, conduct and analyze different experiments.
You are eager to learn, hungry for knowledge, and want to work towards growing in your career from day one.
You are independent in solving problems within your capabilities and proactive in asking for support when the task is beyond your expertise


Individuals representing diverse profiles, and abilities, encompassing various genders, ethnicities, and backgrounds, are less likely to apply for this role if they do not possess solid experience in 100% of these areas. Even if it seems you don't meet our musts don't let it stop you, we are all about finding the best talent out there! Skills can be learned, and embracing diversity is invaluable.

We Believe Driven Talent Deserves


🌟 An enticing equity plan that lets you own a piece of the action.
💪 Top-notch private health insurance to keep you at your peak.
🍔 Monthly Glovo credit to satisfy your cravings!
💳 Cobee discounts on transportation, food, and even kindergarten expenses.
🏊 Discounted gym memberships to keep you energized.
🏖️ Extra time off, the freedom to work from home two days a week, and the opportunity to work from anywhere for up to three weeks a year!
👪 Enhanced parental leave, and office-based nursery.
🧠 Online therapy and wellbeing benefits to ensure your mental well-being.


Here at Glovo, we thrive on diversity, we believe it enhances our teams, products, and culture. We know that the best ideas come from a mashup of brilliant diverse minds. This is why we are committed to providing equal opportunities to talent from all backgrounds - all genders, racial/diverse backgrounds, abilities, ages, sexual orientations and all other unique characteristics that make you YOU. We will encourage you to bring your authentic self to work, fostering an inclusive environment where everyone feels heard.

Feel free to note your pronouns in your application (e.g., she/her/hers, he/him/his, they/them/theirs, etc).

So, ready to take the wheel and make this the ride of your life?

Delve into our culture by taking a peek at our Instagram and check out our Linkedin and website!
Show more

We will encourage you to bring your authentic self to work, fostering an inclusive environment where everyone feels heard.

Feel free to note your pronouns in your application (e.g., she/her/hers, he/him/his, they/them/theirs, etc).

So, ready to take the wheel and make this the ride of your life?

Delve into our culture by taking a peek at our Instagram and check out our Linkedin and website!

Title: Data Analyst - Becario Tiempo Completo - Mercado español - Barcelona (Enero 2025)
Description:
Durante casi 10 años, papernest ha ayudado con éxito a más de 1,5 millones de usuarios a aliviar una de las tareas más tediosas de la vida: la gestión de contratos. Nuestra solución innovadora permite a los clientes trasladar, gestionar y cambiar sus contratos sin problemas, todo dentro de una plataforma unificada y, lo mejor de todo, ¡gratis! Nuestros servicios están disponibles en Francia, España e Italia (¡por el momento!).

En un mundo en constante cambio, damos pasos firmes, guiados por el desarrollo continuo de nuestro modelo de negocio autosostenible. Nuestra historia de éxito se basa en un modelo B2B2C innovador, forjado a través de alianzas estratégicas con actores importantes en el sector inmobiliario y bancario.

Estamos comprometidos a fomentar un entorno de trabajo emocionante y dinámico, porque eso es lo que saca lo mejor de nosotros. Creemos que los negocios deben ser disruptivos y ambiciosos para prosperar.

Sin embargo, no nos limitamos a ser buenos en los negocios. También estamos comprometidos con nuestra responsabilidad social, ya que nos esforzamos por contribuir activamente a la comunidad a la que pertenecemos, minimizar nuestro impacto ambiental y fomentar una cultura de compromiso y conciencia social entre nuestros compañeros de trabajo.

En el corazón de nuestra filosofía está el compromiso con el éxito a largo plazo, en lugar de la conveniencia a corto plazo. Valoramos enormemente las contribuciones de cada uno de nuestros más de 800 empleados, brindándoles amplias oportunidades de crecimiento y el desarrollo de habilidades invaluables.

Entonces, ¿listo/a para unirte a la aventura?

Para afrontar estos desafíos, estamos contratando un/a Data Analyst en prácticas tiempo completo para un periodo de 6 meses a partir de enero de 2025.

Basado/a en Barcelona, trabajarás activamente en diversas problemáticas de datos para ayudar al equipo a resolver problemas, ser más eficiente y iterar más rápidamente gracias a datos fiables.

⚡️Tus misiones:

Mejorar la productividad de varios equipos comerciales:


Automatizar el cálculo de primas de nuestro equipo comercial, compuesto por más de 400 personas repartidas entre Francia y España.

Automatizar ciertas tareas del equipo mediante la creación de nuevas herramientas innovadoras.
Implementar sistemas de alertas para detectar posibles problemas y anticipar cambios en el mercado.

Crear valor a través de analytics:

Realizar análisis ad hoc para apoyar la toma de decisiones e identificar palancas de crecimiento.
Realizar análisis profundos en temas que cruzan Operaciones, Calidad y RRHH (reclutamiento, desarrollo de habilidades, etc.).
Producir análisis ad hoc y proponer mejoras operativas.

Garantizar la fiabilidad y accesibilidad de los datos.

Asegurar la fiabilidad de los datos provenientes de diferentes fuentes:

Mantener y desarrollar dashboards para hacer accesibles los datos al equipo operativo.




🔎 Tu perfil:
Eres graduado/a de una escuela de ingeniería o comercio.
Te apasionan los datos y el mundo digital.
Eres meticuloso/a, ingenioso/a e independiente.
Tienes experiencia con SQL, el tratamiento y la visualización de datos (Tableau, Data Studio, etc.).
Hablas español nativo y tienes un buen nivel de inglés.
Idealmente, tienes competencias en ciencia de datos.

💜 Lo que te ofrecemos :

Al unirte a papernest podrás desarrollarte profesionalmente en un entorno de trabajo :

Flexible gracias a una política "remote friendly" (1 día de teletrabajo posible a la semana) 🤸🏾‍♀️
Inclusiva, todo el mundo tiene su sitio en papernest, y con más de 46 nacionalidades diferentes, no es raro empezar una frase en español y finish it in english or french🌍
Cómodo con increíbles oficinas y 1500 m2 de terrazas y jardín, todo a 5 minutos de la playa, perfecto para días de almuerzos al sol 🌞
Fomentando una cohesión de equipo con eventos y team buildings recurrentes🤝
Gourmet: ¡desayuno ofrecido por papernest todos los martes! 😋

🌟Proceso de selección:
Primera llamada en inglés con Lucie, Talent Acquisition Specialist
Un Test de SQL
Una entrevista con tu futuro/a manager.
Una última entrevista con el Lead Data Analyst, Michel

Si esta es tu oportunidad, ¡no la dejes escapar!

Queremos conocerte, no importa tu sexo, raza, edad, religión, discapacidad u orientación sexual. Nuestros procesos de selección e instalaciones son inclusivos y adaptados para todas las personas, ¡la diversidad es una ventaja para nuestros equipos!

Title: BI Data Acquisition Analyst
Description:
Job Title

BI Data Acquisition Analyst

Summary Of The Role

The BI Data Acquisition Analyst will be instrumental in on-boarding global hospitality industry data to support our Business Intelligence Solutions. This role will perform a diverse set of critical duties related to the implementation and maintenance of processes to acquire and retain quality data assets. This role will work with the top global hospitality organizations and independent hotels to deliver data that meet extract specifications and pass data validation standards.

Your Main Responsibilities


Facilitate communication between the business and technical teams throughout the data acquisition process.
Analyze and document business requirements to support the data acquisition process.
Identify areas for data quality improvement and resolve data quality problems through error detection, correction, process improvement, and process design strategies.
Utilize data profiling tools and database queries to uncover and determine root causes of data quality issues.
Recommend enhancements to data acquisition processes and systems of record to improve data accuracy.
Conduct ongoing data analysis and auditing to support timely and accurate delivery to clients.


About The Ideal Candidate


Relevant experience in the hospitality industry and familiarity with hospitality standards and terminology.
Experience with the SQL query language is beneficial.
Familiarity with Business Intelligence and ETL (Extract, Transform, Load) workflows is beneficial.
Proven ability to efficiently manage and implement tactical projects.
Understanding of database and data warehouse architecture is beneficial.
Self-starter who works well in a collaborative and dynamic environment.


What We Can Offer You


💰 A complete rewards offer - Amadeus provides attractive remuneration packages, covering all essential components of a competitive reward offer, including bonus, equity, pension plan, travel, life and healthcare insurance, as well as lunch and transport allowance and other benefits.
🌎 A truly global DNA - Everything at Amadeus is global, from our people to our business, which translates into our footprint, processes, and culture.
🎓 Great opportunities to learn - Learning happens all the time and in many ways at Amadeus, through on-the-job training, formal learning activities, and day-to-day interactions with colleagues.
🤗 A caring environment - Amadeus fosters a caring environment, nurturing both a fulfilling career and personal and family life. We care about our employees and strive to provide a supportive work environment.
🌟 A flexible working model - We want our employees to do their best work, wherever and however it works best for them.
🌈 A diverse and inclusive community - We are committed to leveraging our uniquely diverse population to drive innovation, creativity, and collaboration across our organization.
📈 A Reliable Company - Trust and reliability are fundamental values that drive our actions and shape long-lasting relationships with our customers, partners, and employees.
🎯 A critical mission and purpose - At Amadeus, you will be powering the future of travel and pursuing a critical mission and extraordinary purpose.


Are you the one we’re looking for? Apply now!

Diversity & Inclusion

Amadeus aspires to be a leader in Diversity, Equity and Inclusion in the tech industry, enabling every employee to reach their full potential by fostering a culture of belonging and fair treatment, attracting the best talent from all backgrounds, and as a role model for an inclusive employee experience. 

Amadeus is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to gender, race, ethnicity, sexual orientation, age, beliefs, disability or any other characteristics protected by law. 


Show more

Title: Lead Data Analyst Operaciones eCommerce
Description:
En Mango inspiramos y unimos mediante nuestra pasión por el estilo y la cultura. Estamos en más de 115 países y nuestra presencia online se extiende a más de 110 países. Nuestro equipo está formado por personas de 112 nacionalidades y en un 78% por mujeres.

Buscamos un/a

Lead Data Analyst Operaciones eCommerce

¿CÓMO SERIA TU DÍA A DÍA EN MANGO?

Tu objetivo será desarrollar la visión analítica de las operaciones online y generar insights que ayuden a la toma de decisiones de negocio.

En tu día a día…


Definirás los principales KPIs y darás visibilidad sobre los indicadores de negocio de operaciones
Mejorarás la calidad de los datos en colaboración con los equipos de Data Science y Tecnología
Realizarás Benchmark de los principales mercados para identificar opciones de mejora
Crearás las alertas necesarias para detección de incidencias


¿QUÉ ESPERAMOS DE TI?


Que tengas formación en áreas cuantitativas (Matemáticas, Estadística, IT, Ingeniería…)
Que aportes entre 5 años de experiencia laboral en análisis de datos, datamining.
Que tengas experiencia habiendo analizado grandes volúmenes de datos.
Que conozcas herramientas de data visualisation (Qlik Sense, Tableau)
Que tengas experiencia en herramientas estadísticas (R/Python, programación SQL…) y un nivel avanzado de Excel
Que tengas capacidad analítica, técnica y de resolución de problemas.
Valoraremos positivamente experiencia en e-commerce y operaciones


¿QUÉ NOS HACE ESPECIALES?


Horario Flexible (entrada de 8h a 9h30 y salida de 17h a 18h30), jornada intensiva los viernes (de 8h a 9h hasta las 14h / 15h) y mayoría de vigilias de festivos
Posibilidad de Teletrabajo
Descuento en todas nuestras líneas (Woman, Man, Kids, Teen & Home) además de un Market de muestrario para renovar tu armario dos veces al año
Servicio de comedor y cocina en las instalaciones de central. La empresa subvenciona parte del menú diario, así como los artículos de cafetería
Retribución flexible con ventajas fiscales: seguro médico, formación, descuento comedor, guarderías etc.
Transporte gratuito de empresa desde Barcelona y el Vallés
Oportunidades constantes de desarrollo con retos muy variados que generan aprendizaje en el puesto de trabajo y cursos específicos en función de tus necesidades
Workshops, meetups, comunidades de prácticas, team buildings y company meetings sobre transformación digital, moda y actividades de nuestros equipos
Servicio médico propio, servicio de fisioterapia una vez a la semana, sala de fitness y vestuarios en nuestras oficinas centrales
Formarás parte de una empresa líder en el sector de la moda, dinámica, en plena innovación, con gran concienciación y realizando acciones hacia la sostenibilidad con un ambiente de trabajo cercano, inspirador y ambicioso


You got it?

We like you!
Show more

Title: [Bo689] - Analista Business Intelligence (Bi)
Description:
Malthus Darwin es una empresa de Consultoría, especializada en la búsqueda, selección y evaluación de perfiles IT.

Nuestro principal objetivo es proporcionar los mejores recursos humanos a nuestros clientes con la mayor rapidez y la máxima eficacia ofreciendo siempre un servicio de calidad.

En estos momentos estamos trabajando una posición de Analista Business Intelligence para la prevención del fraude bancario para trabajar con un importante cliente del sector.

Requisitos: Experiencia en fraude bancario Análisis de datos usando lenguajes como Python / SQL / R Definición de modelos estadísticos para la identificación de patrones de fraude.

Generación de reportes en herramientas de visualización (Micro, Tableau, Power BI) Modalidad híbrida en Madrid Banda salarial: según experiencia Si buscas nuevos retos profesionales y tu perfil encaja con la descripción, ¡anímate a saber más!

Inscríbete o envía tu CV a ****** #J-18808-Ljbffr

Title: Analista Power BI
Description:
En BETWEEN apostamos por el mejor talento dentro del sector tecnológico. Nos involucramos en una gran variedad de proyectos punteros, trabajando con las últimas tecnologías. Actualmente en BETWEEN contamos con un equipo de más de 800 personas.

Trabajamos en ámbitos como BI, IoT, Big Data e I+D. En el área de Operaciones implantamos proyectos de Service Desk, Infraestructuras IT y proyectos Cloud, entre otros.

Actualmente seleccionamos un Analista PowerBI para incorporarse de forma indefinida en uno de los equipos de I+D que Between tiene implantados en uno de nuestros principales clientes.

La persona seleccionada trabajará con el equipo de Data para la gestión de datos y generación de informes.

¿Qué haré? Estas serán tus funciones principales:


Te encargarás de realizar informes
Realizarás gestión de datos.



Formarás parte de dos equipos. Colaborando directamente con negocio en el departamento de Sostenibilidad y con el equipo de Data en el departamento de IT.

Si eres BETWEENER obtendrás estos beneficios:


Seguro médico con Sanitas.
Dispondrás de oportunidades de formación y desarrollo profesional: Idiomas, cursos en Udemy, Certificaciones, Programa The Power Business School y Bootcamps especializados (Agile, DevOps, IA & Big Data, Ciberseguridad, etc.).
Contarás con un equipo de Talento que te acompañará durante toda tu experiencia con nosotros. ¡Haremos un café una vez al mes! Así, mantendremos el contacto.
Pondremos a tu disposición un amplio abanico de retos y proyectos acordes con tus objetivos personales y profesionales.
Posibilidad de elegir cómo obtener parte de tu salario gracias a las ventajas fiscales de nuestra Retribución Flexible (Ticket restaurant, Ticket transporte, Ticket guardería).
Descuentos para acceder a centros de Fitness con Gympass.
Acceso a nuestro Club de Descuentos: Inspiring Benefits.
En BETWEEN nos gusta mucho hacer networking, por lo que te invitaremos a participar en todos estos eventos ¡y más!: las BETWEEN Nights, torneos deportivos, Black Mamba Race, viernes de vermut, juegos de mesa, etc.
Podrás disfrutar de nuestras fantásticas oficinas del 22@ las cuales disponen de Rooftop, tirador de cerveza, mesa de ping-pong y futbolín.
Programa de recomendación remunerado de Talento.
En BETWEEN, la igualdad de oportunidades es uno de nuestros valores. Nuestro compromiso es contratar al mejor talento independientemente de su religión, sexo, edad y personas con otras capacidades y promover su desarrollo profesional y personal.

Imprescindible:


Excel avanzado
Manejo de PowerBI

Gestión y análisis de datos

HTML:
En BETWEEN apostamos por el mejor talento dentro del sector tecnológico. Nos involucramos en una gran variedad de proyectos punteros, trabajando con las últimas tecnologías. Actualmente en BETWEEN contamos con un equipo de más de 800 personas.

Trabajamos en ámbitos como BI, IoT, Big Data e I+D. En el área de Operaciones implantamos proyectos de Service Desk, Infraestructuras IT y proyectos Cloud, entre otros.

Actualmente seleccionamos un Analista PowerBI para incorporarse de forma indefinida en uno de los equipos de I+D que Between tiene implantados en uno de nuestros principales clientes.

La persona seleccionada trabajará con el equipo de Data para la gestión de datos y generación de informes.

¿Qué haré? Estas serán tus funciones principales:

  • Te encargarás de realizar informes
  • Realizarás gestión de datos.


Formarás parte de dos equipos. Colaborando directamente con negocio en el departamento de Sostenibilidad y con el equipo de Data en el departamento de IT.

Si eres BETWEENER obtendrás estos beneficios:

  • Seguro médico con Sanitas.
  • Dispondrás de oportunidades de formación y desarrollo profesional: Idiomas, cursos en Udemy, Certificaciones, Programa The Power Business School y Bootcamps especializados (Agile, DevOps, IA & Big Data, Ciberseguridad, etc.).
  • Contarás con un equipo de Talento que te acompañará durante toda tu experiencia con nosotros. ¡Haremos un café una vez al mes! Así, mantendremos el contacto.
  • Pondremos a tu disposición un amplio abanico de retos y proyectos acordes con tus objetivos personales y profesionales.
  • Posibilidad de elegir cómo obtener parte de tu salario gracias a las ventajas fiscales de nuestra Retribución Flexible (Ticket restaurant, Ticket transporte, Ticket guardería).
  • Descuentos para acceder a centros de Fitness con Gympass.
  • Acceso a nuestro Club de Descuentos: Inspiring Benefits.
  • En BETWEEN nos gusta mucho hacer networking, por lo que te invitaremos a participar en todos estos eventos ¡y más!: las BETWEEN Nights, torneos deportivos, Black Mamba Race, viernes de vermut, juegos de mesa, etc.
  • Podrás disfrutar de nuestras fantásticas oficinas del 22@ las cuales disponen de Rooftop, tirador de cerveza, mesa de ping-pong y futbolín.
  • Programa de recomendación remunerado de Talento.
  • En BETWEEN, la igualdad de oportunidades es uno de nuestros valores. Nuestro compromiso es contratar al mejor talento independientemente de su religión, sexo, edad y personas con otras capacidades y promover su desarrollo profesional y personal.


Requisitos:

Imprescindible:

  • Excel avanzado
  • Manejo de PowerBI
  • Power Point u herramientas equivalentes para la gestión de presentaciones
  • Gestión y análisis de datos

Title: Senior BI Consultant
Description:
Hays Technology is collaborating with the leading company in the Data Sector, with a clear goal to become one of EMEA's largest D&A consulting companies. Their services are based on the latest market-leading enterprise technology platforms, and delivered by a dynamic team of expert consultants. Their strength lies in our ability to efficiently deliver customer insight and value, gained through decades of experience with real-world challenges.




We are looking for a Senior BI Consultant, responsible for developing BI solutions and delivering the best quality projects to our clients world-wide.




What will your duties be?

Conduct Requirements Gathering sessions and perform gap analysis.
Design and develop DataMart’s data models and data pipelines.
Create Power BI data sets, DAX development.
Drive Testing process, define and execute test cases.
Demo solutions to executive users, collect feedback and plan implementation.
Provide training about implemented data marts to Power Users.




What are the requirements?

Ideally Computer Science Engineering, Informatics, Statistics or other degree with interest in the business intelligence field.
Minimum of 4 years of experience in the BI field with the ability to design and implement BI business logic and security models.
Requirements gathering knowledge and experience, incl. wireframe prototyping.
Experience working with dimensionally modelled data such as good understand of DWH concepts.
Proven ETL experience, preferably on Informatica PowerCenter or SQL Server Integration Services.
Customer oriented with excellent communication and presentation skills.
Proactive, team player, committed and constant willingness to improve.
Fluent in English.




What we offer?

Stable and long-term project.
Location: Barcelona.
Hybrid work modality, 2 days in office.
Flexible working schedule.

Show more

Title: Data Analyst - Customer Lifecycle & Growth
Description:
At Preply, we are unlocking human potential through learning.

We believe learning with a great tutor is life-changing. That’s why we match online tutors from across the globe with learners and empower them to create live language classes with AI-powered tools and learning materials. This is how we deliver progress, create engagement and keep our global community of learners motivated. So far, over 32,000 tutors have given more than 15 million lessons to learners from over 175 countries.

Meet the team!

At Preply, we're growing a talented Data Team to empower top-notch decision-making across our organization. Our team collaborates closely with various other chapters - including product, business, and platform - leveraging analysis, experimentation, causal inference, and machine learning.

As a key player, you’ll be embedded in cross-functional teams, partnering with Product Managers, Marketing, Tech Leads, and the Data Strategy team. Check out our Tech Radar to see the tools and technologies we love using at Preply!

What You’ll Be Doing


Develop and implement data frameworks to enhance our organic growth strategies, including SEO, CRM, and Referral programs
Drive virality and word-of-mouth growth by analyzing user behavior and helping teams capitalize opportunities where we have high user engagement
Generate strategic insights to shape top-level roadmaps.
Collaborate with teams to define KPIs for organic growth and maintain dashboards to monitor performance.
Identify trends and opportunities, providing actionable insights to support team initiatives.
Examples of areas you will cover are:
Collect, organize and interpret, utilizing statistical and analytical techniques, trends, patterns, and correlations from large SEO data sets (internal and external data)
Analyze cross-channel data, particularly in SEO and SEM, to optimize marketing efficiency and prevent cannibalization.

What You Need To Succeed


3-5 years' experience in Data Science/Analysis, focusing on data analytics for business or product growth;
Previous experience in fast-paced Technology or Management Consulting companies;
Proven ability to work with product teams, run AB experiments, and identify product optimization opportunities;
Strong background in quantitative fields (e.g., statistics, mathematics);
Proficient coding skills in SQL and Python;
An outcome-driven approach with a passion for problem-solving and exploring new ideas.
A creative mindset with a proactive attitude, along with stakeholder management and influencing skills;
Fluency in English and eager to work on a global product with a multicultural team.


Nice To Have


Experience with CRM tools (e.g., Braze) and referral programs;
Knowledge of SEO and third-party tools (e.g., Google Search Console, Ahrefs, Adwords);
Familiarity with predictive modeling;
Experience in digital businesses (B2B, B2C, B2B2C);
Knowledge of Looker, Amplitude, Snowflake, and growth/retention analytics frameworks.


Why You’ll Love It At Preply


An open, collaborative, dynamic and diverse culture;
A generous monthly allowance for lessons on Preply.com, Learning & Development budget and time off for your self-development;
A competitive financial package with equity, leave allowance and health insurance;
Not in Barcelona? We offer an attractive relocation package to join us in our Preply Barcelona Hub
Access to free mental health support platforms;
Access to Gympass-partnered wellness and gym centers throughout Spain to promote and support well-being and physical health;
The opportunity to unlock the potential of learners and tutors through language learning and teaching in 175 countries (and counting!).


Our Principles


Care to change the world - We are passionate about our work and care deeply about its impact to be life changing.
We do it for learners - For both Preply and tutors, learners are why we do what we do. Every day we focus on empowering tutors to deliver an exceptional learning experience.
Keep perfecting - To create an outstanding customer experience, we focus on simplicity, smoothness, and enjoyment, continually perfecting it as every detail matters.
Now is the time - In a fast-paced world, it matters how quickly we act. Now is the time to make great things happen.
Disciplined execution - What makes us disciplined is the excellence in our execution. We set clear goals, focus on what matters, and utilize our resources efficiently.
Dive deep - We leverage business acumen and curiosity to investigate disparities between numbers and stories, unlocking meaningful insights to guide our decisions.
Growth mindset - We proactively seek growth opportunities and believe today's best performance becomes tomorrow's starting point. We humbly embrace feedback and learn from setbacks.
Raise the bar - We raise our performance standards continuously, alongside each new hire and promotion. We build diverse and high-performing teams that can make a real difference.
Challenge, disagree and commit - We value open and candid communication, even when we don’t fully agree. We speak our minds, challenge when necessary, and fully commit to decisions once made.
One Preply - We prioritize collaboration, inclusion, and the success of our team over personal ambitions. Together, we support and celebrate each other's progress.


Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion

Preply is committed to creating a diverse and inclusive environment where people from all backgrounds can thrive. Different opinions and viewpoints are key ingredients in our success as a multicultural Ed-Tech company.

Preply will consider all applications for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, disability, age or veteran status. Together, we are The World Class.

Title: Staff/Principal Data Analyst (d/f/m)
Description:
The Role: How you'll make an impact at Personio

This position can be office-based or hybrid, from one of the following countries: Germany, Spain, Ireland, the Netherlands, or the UK.

Drive Strategic Decisions. Shape Our Future. The Data Department is on a mission to facilitate better decisions within the company. We build core data products and enable internal teams to create and share their own. Join our team and help us build the foundation of data at Personio.

As a Staff/Principal Data Analyst supporting the Finance, Legal, and Strategy (FLS) team at Personio, you play a pivotal role in transforming data into strategic insights, shaping our company’s financial strategy. In this role, you're not just analyzing numbers; you're driving critical business decisions and influencing long-term strategies. Your insights directly impact our financial health and strategic direction, making your contribution vital to our mission of sustainable growth and operational excellence.

Role Responsibilities: What you'll do


Strategic Business Partnership: Act as a primary data strategist for the organization, partnering with top executives. Regularly consult with the CFO and other executives, providing data-driven guidance on major strategic initiatives and long-term planning.
Data Analysis: Analyze and interpret diverse datasets, focusing on financial performance, legal trends, and strategic initiatives to guide FLS in making informed, data-driven decisions.
Dashboard Development: Create and strategize the evolution of real-time, interactive dashboards for stakeholders, ensuring they are user-friendly and aligned with the evolving needs of the business.
Business Reviews and Insight Generation: Oversee the insight generation process for business reviews at a company-wide level, guiding analysts in different departments to highlight crucial insights and trends.
Strategic Planning: Collaborate with leadership and peers in developing business strategies grounded in data insights, aimed at growth, operational optimization, and cost reduction.
Stakeholder Management: Lead multiple projects simultaneously, managing expectations and collaborating with the data team for internal consistency, scalability, and reliability of data practices.
Proactive Team Embedding: Act as a strategic data partner for multiple teams, guiding them in aligning their objectives with data insights. Lead initiatives to use data in solving complex business challenges.


Role Requirements: What you need to succeed


Education & Experience: A quantitative degree (e.g., Applied Math, Econ, Stats, Eng, CS) paired with a minimum of 7 years of data analytics experience, in a SaaS, Subscription, or B2B environment with a focus on Finance, Legal, and Strategy. Experience working with executive-level stakeholders (CFO, CEO, …).
Deep understanding of SaaS-specific financial processes and financial systems like Salesforce, Chargebee, Adaptive.
KPI and Dashboard Expertise: Strong understanding of financial and strategic KPIs and proficient in creating scalable dashboards that effectively translate business requirements into impactful visuals.
Technical Proficiency: Advanced skills in SQL and BI/Visualization tools like Tableau, facilitating data extraction, manipulation, and presentation.
Statistical Knowledge: Master the use of cutting-edge statistical methods and tools, providing strategic guidance and recommendations based on sophisticated data analysis.
Analytical Mindset: Intellectual curiosity to delve deep into data, identifying underlying trends, patterns, and actionable insights.
Communication Skills: Ability to articulate complex data observations in simple terms, ensuring clarity and understanding among stakeholders. Master the art of storytelling with data, driving organizational change and strategy through powerful presentations and reports.
Entrepreneurial Approach: A proactive problem-solver, focused on generating impactful results and identifying opportunities for improvement through data-driven insights.


Why Personio

Personio is an equal opportunities employer, committed to building an integrative culture where everyone feels welcomed and supported. We embrace uniqueness and understand that our diverse, values-driven culture makes us stronger. We are proud to have an inclusive workplace environment that will foster your development no matter your gender, civil status, family status, sexual orientation, religion, age, disability, education level, or race.

Benefits

Aside from our people, culture, and mission, check out some of the other benefits that make Personio a great place to work:


Receive a competitive reward package – reevaluated each year – that includes salary, benefits, and pre-IPO equity
Enjoy 28 days of paid vacation, plus an additional day after 2 and 4 years (because we love what we do, but we also love vacation!)
Make an impact on the environment and society with 2 (fully paid) Impact Days – one for an individual project of your choice and one for a company-wide initiative
Receive generous family leave, child support, mental health support, and sabbatical opportunities with PersonioCares
Find your best way to work with our office-led, remote-friendly PersonioFlex! Most teams offer a roughly 50% remote, 50% in-office working framework
Invest in your development with an annual personal development budget to use on professional memberships, external certifications, conferences, and more
Connect with your fellow Personios at regular company and team events like All Company Culture Week and local year-end celebrations
Engage in a high-impact working environment with flat hierarchies and short decision-making processes


About Us

Bring your best. Make your mark. We’re using technology to revolutionize the way HR operates so that we can transform the way millions of people experience work every day. We move fast, challenge the status quo, and support our people as they shape their careers.

With over 10,000 customers and a team of 2,000 in eight offices around the world, now is the perfect time to join! We believe in hiring driven people who want to make an impact. So bring your best, and let’s build the future of HR technology together.

Discover our Personio Principles, that guide our mindset, behaviours, and the ways we work together:

Exceed Customer Expectations: We anticipate, prioritize, and solve for the needs of our customers.

Deliver Exceptional Results: We dream big and move with urgency to make great things happen.

Elevate One Another: We work together as trusted partners to amplify our collective impact.

Care to Challenge: We care personally and challenge directly to unlock our full potential.

Ignite Positive Momentum: We embrace the challenge with a positive mindset and celebrate our wins together.

Title: Risk Data Analyst
Description:
About The Role

Your mission is to drive insight that helps our business succeed. Your keen eye for detail and analytical prowess will empower us to optimise risk management and financial strategies, seize opportunities, and stay one step ahead of potential threats. With your expertise, we will navigate complex risk landscapes, refine our approaches, and safeguard our business against unforeseen challenges.

What You’ll Do:

As the Risk and Finance Data Analyst, you'll be the dedicated intelligence function to Risk. You’ll work closely with department leads, heads and managers, developing tools and insights that drive strategic initiatives. With a hands-on approach, you’ll explore complex datasets, derive actionable insights, and drive impactful projects. Your role will require a blend of technical expertise, business acumen, and leadership to ensure the effective use of data science methodologies and the successful execution of key strategies.

Key Responsibilities:


Strategic Insights: Partner with Risk and Finance leaders to develop the intelligence roadmap that aligns with organizational goals, prioritizing high-impact projects
Build compelling and action-driving intelligence: Work with the team to deliver meaningful insight that drives measurable outcomes and can be used to inform decision-making and drive business growth.
Risk Assessment and Quantification: Support the risk management team in assessing and quantifying potential risks across various business units.
Data Analysis: Perform exploratory data analysis (EDA), feature engineering, and model development to tackle challenges such as fraud detection
Financial Analysis: Analyse financial data, including revenue, costs, and profitability. Perform financial modelling and forecasting to support commercial decision-making.
Data Visualisation: Own and maintain risk dashboards and reports to communicate key risk metrics and trends to stakeholders.
Regulatory Compliance: Monitor and ensure compliance with relevant risk and financial regulations and industry standards.
Risk Reporting: Prepare and present risk reports to senior management and regulatory bodies.
Cross-functional Collaboration: Work closely with product, operations, risk, and revenue teams to translate data insights into actionable strategies that drive business performance.


What you’ll need:


4+ years of data analytics experience, preferably covering risk and/or finance
Proficiency in analysing complex datasets, extracting meaningful insights, and identifying patterns, trends and anomalies using statistical techniques and tools such as Excel, SQL, Python, or R, and advanced data visualisation tools (e.g. Power BI, Tableau)
Experience with cloud data platforms like Snowflake, Redshift, or Big Query
Ability to develop and validate risk models using statistical and econometric methods.
Ability to communicate complex risk and financial concepts and findings to both technical and non-technical audiences.


What we offer:


Dynamic working environment in a extremely fast growing company
Ample opportunity to grow and learn
Hybrid working environment
Flexible working
Unlimited holiday


Show more
HTML:
About The Role

Your mission is to drive insight that helps our business succeed. Your keen eye for detail and analytical prowess will empower us to optimise risk management and financial strategies, seize opportunities, and stay one step ahead of potential threats. With your expertise, we will navigate complex risk landscapes, refine our approaches, and safeguard our business against unforeseen challenges.

What You’ll Do:

As the Risk and Finance Data Analyst, you'll be the dedicated intelligence function to Risk. You’ll work closely with department leads, heads and managers, developing tools and insights that drive strategic initiatives. With a hands-on approach, you’ll explore complex datasets, derive actionable insights, and drive impactful projects. Your role will require a blend of technical expertise, business acumen, and leadership to ensure the effective use of data science methodologies and the successful execution of key strategies.

Key Responsibilities:

  • Strategic Insights: Partner with Risk and Finance leaders to develop the intelligence roadmap that aligns with organizational goals, prioritizing high-impact projects
  • Build compelling and action-driving intelligence: Work with the team to deliver meaningful insight that drives measurable outcomes and can be used to inform decision-making and drive business growth.
  • Risk Assessment and Quantification: Support the risk management team in assessing and quantifying potential risks across various business units.
  • Data Analysis: Perform exploratory data analysis (EDA), feature engineering, and model development to tackle challenges such as fraud detection
  • Financial Analysis: Analyse financial data, including revenue, costs, and profitability. Perform financial modelling and forecasting to support commercial decision-making.
  • Data Visualisation: Own and maintain risk dashboards and reports to communicate key risk metrics and trends to stakeholders.
  • Regulatory Compliance: Monitor and ensure compliance with relevant risk and financial regulations and industry standards.
  • Risk Reporting: Prepare and present risk reports to senior management and regulatory bodies.
  • Cross-functional Collaboration: Work closely with product, operations, risk, and revenue teams to translate data insights into actionable strategies that drive business performance.

What you’ll need:

  • 4+ years of data analytics experience, preferably covering risk and/or finance
  • Proficiency in analysing complex datasets, extracting meaningful insights, and identifying patterns, trends and anomalies using statistical techniques and tools such as Excel, SQL, Python, or R, and advanced data visualisation tools (e.g. Power BI, Tableau)
  • Experience with cloud data platforms like Snowflake, Redshift, or Big Query
  • Ability to develop and validate risk models using statistical and econometric methods.
  • Ability to communicate complex risk and financial concepts and findings to both technical and non-technical audiences.

What we offer:

  • Dynamic working environment in a extremely fast growing company
  • Ample opportunity to grow and learn
  • Hybrid working environment
  • Flexible working
  • Unlimited holiday

Title: Data Analyst - Becario Tiempo Completo - Mercado español - Barcelona (Enero 2025)
Description:
Durante casi 10 años, papernest ha ayudado con éxito a más de 1,5 millones de usuarios a aliviar una de las tareas más tediosas de la vida: la gestión de contratos. Nuestra solución innovadora permite a los clientes trasladar, gestionar y cambiar sus contratos sin problemas, todo dentro de una plataforma unificada y, lo mejor de todo, ¡gratis! Nuestros servicios están disponibles en Francia, España e Italia (¡por el momento!).

En un mundo en constante cambio, damos pasos firmes, guiados por el desarrollo continuo de nuestro modelo de negocio autosostenible. Nuestra historia de éxito se basa en un modelo B2B2C innovador, forjado a través de alianzas estratégicas con actores importantes en el sector inmobiliario y bancario.

Estamos comprometidos a fomentar un entorno de trabajo emocionante y dinámico, porque eso es lo que saca lo mejor de nosotros. Creemos que los negocios deben ser disruptivos y ambiciosos para prosperar.

Sin embargo, no nos limitamos a ser buenos en los negocios. También estamos comprometidos con nuestra responsabilidad social, ya que nos esforzamos por contribuir activamente a la comunidad a la que pertenecemos, minimizar nuestro impacto ambiental y fomentar una cultura de compromiso y conciencia social entre nuestros compañeros de trabajo.

En el corazón de nuestra filosofía está el compromiso con el éxito a largo plazo, en lugar de la conveniencia a corto plazo. Valoramos enormemente las contribuciones de cada uno de nuestros más de 800 empleados, brindándoles amplias oportunidades de crecimiento y el desarrollo de habilidades invaluables.

Entonces, ¿listo/a para unirte a la aventura?

Para afrontar estos desafíos, estamos contratando un/a Data Analyst en prácticas tiempo completo para un periodo de 6 meses a partir de enero de 2025.

Basado/a en Barcelona, trabajarás activamente en diversas problemáticas de datos para ayudar al equipo a resolver problemas, ser más eficiente y iterar más rápidamente gracias a datos fiables.

⚡️Tus misiones:

Mejorar la productividad de varios equipos comerciales:


Automatizar el cálculo de primas de nuestro equipo comercial, compuesto por más de 400 personas repartidas entre Francia y España.

Automatizar ciertas tareas del equipo mediante la creación de nuevas herramientas innovadoras.
Implementar sistemas de alertas para detectar posibles problemas y anticipar cambios en el mercado.

Crear valor a través de analytics:

Realizar análisis ad hoc para apoyar la toma de decisiones e identificar palancas de crecimiento.
Realizar análisis profundos en temas que cruzan Operaciones, Calidad y RRHH (reclutamiento, desarrollo de habilidades, etc.).
Producir análisis ad hoc y proponer mejoras operativas.

Garantizar la fiabilidad y accesibilidad de los datos.

Asegurar la fiabilidad de los datos provenientes de diferentes fuentes:

Mantener y desarrollar dashboards para hacer accesibles los datos al equipo operativo.




🔎 Tu perfil:
Eres graduado/a de una escuela de ingeniería o comercio.
Te apasionan los datos y el mundo digital.
Eres meticuloso/a, ingenioso/a e independiente.
Tienes experiencia con SQL, el tratamiento y la visualización de datos (Tableau, Data Studio, etc.).
Hablas español nativo y tienes un buen nivel de inglés.
Idealmente, tienes competencias en ciencia de datos.

💜 Lo que te ofrecemos :

Al unirte a papernest podrás desarrollarte profesionalmente en un entorno de trabajo :

Flexible gracias a una política "remote friendly" (1 día de teletrabajo posible a la semana) 🤸🏾‍♀️
Inclusiva, todo el mundo tiene su sitio en papernest, y con más de 46 nacionalidades diferentes, no es raro empezar una frase en español y finish it in english or french🌍
Cómodo con increíbles oficinas y 1500 m2 de terrazas y jardín, todo a 5 minutos de la playa, perfecto para días de almuerzos al sol 🌞
Fomentando una cohesión de equipo con eventos y team buildings recurrentes🤝
Gourmet: ¡desayuno ofrecido por papernest todos los martes! 😋

🌟Proceso de selección:
Primera llamada en inglés con Lucie, Talent Acquisition Specialist
Un Test de SQL
Una entrevista con tu futuro/a manager.
Una última entrevista con el Lead Data Analyst, Michel

Si esta es tu oportunidad, ¡no la dejes escapar!

Queremos conocerte, no importa tu sexo, raza, edad, religión, discapacidad u orientación sexual. Nuestros procesos de selección e instalaciones son inclusivos y adaptados para todas las personas, ¡la diversidad es una ventaja para nuestros equipos!

Title: Becario/a Data Analyst
Description:
Estamos buscando un/a estudiante en prácticas que quiera formar parte del equipo de Metadatos, en nuestra división Editorial Librerías.

Bajo la supervisión de la responsable del departamento y coordinación con el resto del equipo digital, participarás en las siguientes tareas:


Gestionar, analizar e interpretar bases de datos.
Elaborar informes y reportes de los metadatos estratégicos para la propuesta de mejoras.
Seguimiento de los circuitos y de la calidad de los datos para verificar que todo el contenido llega correctamente al cliente.



¿Qué ofrecemos?


Beca remunerada.
Horario en jornada presencial de lunes a viernes de 9h a 15h.
Aprenderás día a día rodead@ de un equipo dinámico, divertido, profesional y expert@s en la materia.



Requisitos:

¿Qué nos gustaría ver en tu CV?


Estudios en Economía, Data, Marketing, Ingeniería o afines.
Motivación personal por el sector editorial.
Que tengas la posibilidad de firmar un convenio de prácticas con tu centro de estudios mínimo de 6 meses.
Capacidad de análisis, síntesis y comunicación.
Interés en manejo de base de datos, gestión de proyectos y estrategias de mercado.
Dominio de herramientas ofimáticas. Se valorará Excel Avanzado.
Se valorará formación complementaria y/o experiencia en Marketing Digital.
Persona organizada, dinámica, resolutiva y con iniciativa.
Idiomas: catalán y castellano.



¿Qué buscamos en ti?


Motivación por formarse y aprender.
Autonomía y proactividad.
Capacidad de trabajar en equipo.



Si estás interesado/a en unirte a nuestro equipo, envíanos tu CV.

¡Esperamos conocerte pronto!

Title: BI Data Acquisition Analyst
Description:
Job Title

BI Data Acquisition Analyst

Summary Of The Role

The BI Data Acquisition Analyst will be instrumental in on-boarding global hospitality industry data to support our Business Intelligence Solutions. This role will perform a diverse set of critical duties related to the implementation and maintenance of processes to acquire and retain quality data assets. This role will work with the top global hospitality organizations and independent hotels to deliver data that meet extract specifications and pass data validation standards.

Your Main Responsibilities


Facilitate communication between the business and technical teams throughout the data acquisition process.
Analyze and document business requirements to support the data acquisition process.
Identify areas for data quality improvement and resolve data quality problems through error detection, correction, process improvement, and process design strategies.
Utilize data profiling tools and database queries to uncover and determine root causes of data quality issues.
Recommend enhancements to data acquisition processes and systems of record to improve data accuracy.
Conduct ongoing data analysis and auditing to support timely and accurate delivery to clients.


About The Ideal Candidate


Relevant experience in the hospitality industry and familiarity with hospitality standards and terminology.
Experience with the SQL query language is beneficial.
Familiarity with Business Intelligence and ETL (Extract, Transform, Load) workflows is beneficial.
Proven ability to efficiently manage and implement tactical projects.
Understanding of database and data warehouse architecture is beneficial.
Self-starter who works well in a collaborative and dynamic environment.


What We Can Offer You


💰 A complete rewards offer - Amadeus provides attractive remuneration packages, covering all essential components of a competitive reward offer, including bonus, equity, pension plan, travel, life and healthcare insurance, as well as lunch and transport allowance and other benefits.
🌎 A truly global DNA - Everything at Amadeus is global, from our people to our business, which translates into our footprint, processes, and culture.
🎓 Great opportunities to learn - Learning happens all the time and in many ways at Amadeus, through on-the-job training, formal learning activities, and day-to-day interactions with colleagues.
🤗 A caring environment - Amadeus fosters a caring environment, nurturing both a fulfilling career and personal and family life. We care about our employees and strive to provide a supportive work environment.
🌟 A flexible working model - We want our employees to do their best work, wherever and however it works best for them.
🌈 A diverse and inclusive community - We are committed to leveraging our uniquely diverse population to drive innovation, creativity, and collaboration across our organization.
📈 A Reliable Company - Trust and reliability are fundamental values that drive our actions and shape long-lasting relationships with our customers, partners, and employees.
🎯 A critical mission and purpose - At Amadeus, you will be powering the future of travel and pursuing a critical mission and extraordinary purpose.


Are you the one we’re looking for? Apply now!

Diversity & Inclusion

Amadeus aspires to be a leader in Diversity, Equity and Inclusion in the tech industry, enabling every employee to reach their full potential by fostering a culture of belonging and fair treatment, attracting the best talent from all backgrounds, and as a role model for an inclusive employee experience. 

Amadeus is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to gender, race, ethnicity, sexual orientation, age, beliefs, disability or any other characteristics protected by law.

Title: Data Functional Analyst
Description:
At PayRetailers, we are committed to providing cutting-edge solutions that empower businesses to succeed in Latin America & África. Our collaborative and inclusive work environment encourages creativity and growth, where every employee's contribution is valued. Get ready to embark on an exciting journey with us, as we strive to make a meaningful impact on the world of payments.

We find ourselves in an exciting phase of growth, expanding into new markets, and undergoing continuous development. We thrive on working with cutting-edge technologies.

Our Data team is on the lookout for a Functional Data Analyst experienced in translating functional requirements into data specifications, to join us on this adventurous journey. The position is a Data Functional Analyst functional role, responsible for translating functional requirements into data specifications and data models for the company's Data platform.

Job Duties & Responsibilities:


Gather data requirements and translate them into data specifications to evolve the internal Data Platform (DataLake)
Collaborate with stakeholders to understand business requirements with a global vision of the entire data value chain from collection, cleaning, processing, storage and exploitation.
Participate with our Data Engineering team in the design of data solutions, specially focus on data modelling.
Search and navigate into source systems to traceback the origin of the data for its use in the DataLake


Experience and Qualifications:

MUST:


Degree in Computer science, Information Systems, or related field required.
4/3 + years of overall technology experience that includes at least 2+ years of hands-on data.
Strong SQL and NoSQL profficiencly (profiles with juts experience in one of them would not be considered for the role).
Proficient in data modelling (data modeler).
High level of English (C1).
Experience minimza with Data Lake Infrastructure / Data Warehousing.


Nice to have:


Experience in the use of tools such as Databricks, Python, R (estudiar el contenido del dato) or BI tools.
Experience in the online payment sector and payment gateways.
Experience in Azure cloud services.


Soft skills:


Strong oral and written communication skills.
Strong understanding of data modelling concepts, including entity-relationship diagrams (ERD), normalisation, denormalization and star schema.
Strong analytical skills
Ability to work independently and as part of a team.
Results orientation and attention to detail.


What do we offer?


Fully remote (office always available when needed) 😊
26 days of vacations per year.
Free language & technical courses.
Free catering & snacks every day at the office!
Private health insurance.
Free afternoon on your birthday.

Title: Lead Data Analyst Operaciones eCommerce
Description:
En Mango inspiramos y unimos mediante nuestra pasión por el estilo y la cultura. Estamos en más de 115 países y nuestra presencia online se extiende a más de 110 países. Nuestro equipo está formado por personas de 112 nacionalidades y en un 78% por mujeres.

Buscamos un/a

Lead Data Analyst Operaciones eCommerce

¿CÓMO SERIA TU DÍA A DÍA EN MANGO?

Tu objetivo será desarrollar la visión analítica de las operaciones online y generar insights que ayuden a la toma de decisiones de negocio.

En tu día a día…


Definirás los principales KPIs y darás visibilidad sobre los indicadores de negocio de operaciones
Mejorarás la calidad de los datos en colaboración con los equipos de Data Science y Tecnología
Realizarás Benchmark de los principales mercados para identificar opciones de mejora
Crearás las alertas necesarias para detección de incidencias


¿QUÉ ESPERAMOS DE TI?


Que tengas formación en áreas cuantitativas (Matemáticas, Estadística, IT, Ingeniería…)
Que aportes entre 5 años de experiencia laboral en análisis de datos, datamining.
Que tengas experiencia habiendo analizado grandes volúmenes de datos.
Que conozcas herramientas de data visualisation (Qlik Sense, Tableau)
Que tengas experiencia en herramientas estadísticas (R/Python, programación SQL…) y un nivel avanzado de Excel
Que tengas capacidad analítica, técnica y de resolución de problemas.
Valoraremos positivamente experiencia en e-commerce y operaciones


¿QUÉ NOS HACE ESPECIALES?


Horario Flexible (entrada de 8h a 9h30 y salida de 17h a 18h30), jornada intensiva los viernes (de 8h a 9h hasta las 14h / 15h) y mayoría de vigilias de festivos
Posibilidad de Teletrabajo
Descuento en todas nuestras líneas (Woman, Man, Kids, Teen & Home) además de un Market de muestrario para renovar tu armario dos veces al año
Servicio de comedor y cocina en las instalaciones de central. La empresa subvenciona parte del menú diario, así como los artículos de cafetería
Retribución flexible con ventajas fiscales: seguro médico, formación, descuento comedor, guarderías etc.
Transporte gratuito de empresa desde Barcelona y el Vallés
Oportunidades constantes de desarrollo con retos muy variados que generan aprendizaje en el puesto de trabajo y cursos específicos en función de tus necesidades
Workshops, meetups, comunidades de prácticas, team buildings y company meetings sobre transformación digital, moda y actividades de nuestros equipos
Servicio médico propio, servicio de fisioterapia una vez a la semana, sala de fitness y vestuarios en nuestras oficinas centrales
Formarás parte de una empresa líder en el sector de la moda, dinámica, en plena innovación, con gran concienciación y realizando acciones hacia la sostenibilidad con un ambiente de trabajo cercano, inspirador y ambicioso


You got it?

We like you!

HTML:
En Mango inspiramos y unimos mediante nuestra pasión por el estilo y la cultura. Estamos en más de 115 países y nuestra presencia online se extiende a más de 110 países. Nuestro equipo está formado por personas de 112 nacionalidades y en un 78% por mujeres.

Buscamos un/a

Lead Data Analyst Operaciones eCommerce

¿CÓMO SERIA TU DÍA A DÍA EN MANGO?

Tu objetivo será desarrollar la visión analítica de las operaciones online y generar insights que ayuden a la toma de decisiones de negocio.

En tu día a día…

  • Definirás los principales KPIs y darás visibilidad sobre los indicadores de negocio de operaciones
  • Mejorarás la calidad de los datos en colaboración con los equipos de Data Science y Tecnología
  • Realizarás Benchmark de los principales mercados para identificar opciones de mejora
  • Crearás las alertas necesarias para detección de incidencias

¿QUÉ ESPERAMOS DE TI?

  • Que tengas formación en áreas cuantitativas (Matemáticas, Estadística, IT, Ingeniería…)
  • Que aportes entre 5 años de experiencia laboral en análisis de datos, datamining.
  • Que tengas experiencia habiendo analizado grandes volúmenes de datos.
  • Que conozcas herramientas de data visualisation (Qlik Sense, Tableau)
  • Que tengas experiencia en herramientas estadísticas (R/Python, programación SQL…) y un nivel avanzado de Excel
  • Que tengas capacidad analítica, técnica y de resolución de problemas.
  • Valoraremos positivamente experiencia en e-commerce y operaciones

¿QUÉ NOS HACE ESPECIALES?

  • Horario Flexible (entrada de 8h a 9h30 y salida de 17h a 18h30), jornada intensiva los viernes (de 8h a 9h hasta las 14h / 15h) y mayoría de vigilias de festivos
  • Posibilidad de Teletrabajo
  • Descuento en todas nuestras líneas (Woman, Man, Kids, Teen & Home) además de un Market de muestrario para renovar tu armario dos veces al año
  • Servicio de comedor y cocina en las instalaciones de central. La empresa subvenciona parte del menú diario, así como los artículos de cafetería
  • Retribución flexible con ventajas fiscales: seguro médico, formación, descuento comedor, guarderías etc.
  • Transporte gratuito de empresa desde Barcelona y el Vallés
  • Oportunidades constantes de desarrollo con retos muy variados que generan aprendizaje en el puesto de trabajo y cursos específicos en función de tus necesidades
  • Workshops, meetups, comunidades de prácticas, team buildings y company meetings sobre transformación digital, moda y actividades de nuestros equipos
  • Servicio médico propio, servicio de fisioterapia una vez a la semana, sala de fitness y vestuarios en nuestras oficinas centrales
  • Formarás parte de una empresa líder en el sector de la moda, dinámica, en plena innovación, con gran concienciación y realizando acciones hacia la sostenibilidad con un ambiente de trabajo cercano, inspirador y ambicioso

Title: [Bo689] - Analista Business Intelligence (Bi)
Description:
Malthus Darwin es una empresa de Consultoría, especializada en la búsqueda, selección y evaluación de perfiles IT.

Nuestro principal objetivo es proporcionar los mejores recursos humanos a nuestros clientes con la mayor rapidez y la máxima eficacia ofreciendo siempre un servicio de calidad.

En estos momentos estamos trabajando una posición de Analista Business Intelligence para la prevención del fraude bancario para trabajar con un importante cliente del sector.

Requisitos: Experiencia en fraude bancario Análisis de datos usando lenguajes como Python / SQL / R Definición de modelos estadísticos para la identificación de patrones de fraude.

Title: Senior Data Analyst
Description:
Location: Remote (preference for EU timezones) with quarterly travel to the Barcelona office

About the Client:

Our client is a fast-growing digital media company experiencing a significant growth phase. They manage a substantial volume of data with 6 million visitors monthly, providing a robust foundation for advanced growth strategies.

Role Overview:

As the Marketing Senior Data Analyst you will be responsible for harnessing the power of data to drive the marketing strategies and growth initiatives. Working closely with growth hackers and other stakeholders, you will use your data science expertise to provide actionable insights, optimize marketing processes, and support evidence-based decision-making.

Responsibilities:


Lead the development and execution of data-driven experiments across multiple marketing and growth channels.
Collaborate with marketing, product, and growth teams to provide actionable insights and support rapid iterations on growth initiatives.
Build and maintain a strong analytics foundation, ensuring data accuracy and accessibility for key stakeholders.
Analyze large datasets to identify trends, opportunities, and insights that drive marketing strategy.
Collaborate with the Growth Hacker team to develop data-driven strategies for customer acquisition and retention.
Implement and manage machine learning models to enhance marketing effectiveness and efficiency.
Establish data-driven frameworks and processes for goal setting and performance evaluation.
Communicate complex data insights in a clear and actionable manner to non-technical stakeholders.
Continuously explore and apply new data science techniques to improve marketing outcomes.



Qualifications:


Expertise in data-driven growth, marketing analytics, and startup data dynamics.
Proven track record of driving key insights from data to fuel business growth and scale, with experience in high-growth startup environments.
Strong proficiency in data analysis, machine learning, and statistical modeling.
Experience working with large datasets and advanced analytics tools.
Reforge Growth course certifications or similar advanced growth training preferred.
Excellent problem-solving skills and the ability to translate data insights into strategic recommendations.
Strong collaboration skills, with experience working alongside marketing and growth teams.
Willingness to travel quarterly to the Barcelona office.



What We Offer:


A key role in shaping data-driven marketing approach.
Full support from the management team and opportunities to influence key strategies.
Competitive salary, benefits, and travel opportunities.

Title: Senior Data Governance Analyst
Description:
What You'll Do:

Within Finance Transformation, you will join the Data Governance team

composed of highly motivated data specialists and focused on 2 main missions:


Contribute to the definition and evolution of the Data Governance



Framework to maximize its impact, reach and scalability.


Contribute to its deployment on data domains



Your main responsibilities will be:

Working with both Business teams (Commercial, Marketing, Finance,

Reporting...) and IT (CRM, Billing, ERP...), both in the context of company

projects and operations, your main responsibilities will be:


Contribute to the definition and evolutions of our Data Governance



Framework:


Data policies to secure founding principles
Roles and responsibilities to drive a proper ownership and



accountability of data


Data catalog to facilitate other teams’ understanding of data, its



lineage and ownership


Governance committees to ensure a proper knowledge sharing and



prioritization of key data priorities for the company


Data quality framework to have a centralized control tower of our



data quality with clearly defined quality rules, monitoring, alerting,

cleaning procedures, score cards


Support the deployment of our framework to data domains and data sets:
Be a key point of contact and change agent for Data Governance
Support the appointment of data owners and stewards
Support them in maintaining the data catalog (dictionary, lineage,



ownership, confidentiality...)


Support the business maturation and lead the data modeling



maturation on the definition of core data sets to be built by the IT

team and consumed by multiple applications and processes (CRM,

reporting...).


Support data stewards on data assurance and data quality:
Understanding of current processes and pain points
Definition of data quality business rules per object, in a



centralized referential


Ad hoc analysis on data quality
Automated data quality monitoring to feed a central data



quality control tower


Cleaning procedure definition, planning, training and



coordination


Regular reviews of data quality scorecards and alerts to drive



execution

Who You Are:


MS degree in Engineering, Business, Finance or a related degree
5+ years of proven working experience as Data Governance analyst or a



similar position


You demonstrate a high interest and proficiency in Data and BI such as:
Data governance principles and best practices
Data modeling
Data quality / assurance
BI / reporting tools (e.g. PowerBI, Tableau)
SQL
Working experience on Commercial or Financial data domains would be a



plus (CRM / Client data, Invoicing, Accounting...)


Strong analytical skills and problem-solving mind-set
Ease to work in an agile, fast-paced, technological, international and



intercultural environment


Good communication, stakeholder management and change management



skillset


Fluent in English



We acknowledge that many candidates may not meet every single role requirement listed above. If your experience looks a little different from our requirements but you believe that you can still bring value to the role, we’d love to see your application!

Who We Are:

Criteo is the global commerce media company that enables marketers and media owners to deliver richer consumer experiences and drive better commerce outcomes through its industry leading Commerce Media Platform.

At Criteo, our culture is as unique as it is diverse. From our offices around the world or from home, our incredible team of 3,600 Criteos collaborates to develop an open and inclusive environment. We seek to ensure that all of our workers are treated equally, and we do not tolerate discrimination based on race, gender identity, gender, sexual orientation, color, national origin, religion, age, disability, political opinion, pregnancy, migrant status, ethnicity, marital or family status, or other protected characteristics at all stages of the employment lifecycle including how we attract and recruit, through promotions, pay decisions, benefits, career progression and development. We aim to ensure employment decisions and actions are based solely on business-related considerations and not on protected characteristics. As outlined in our Code of Business Conduct and Ethics, we strictly forbid any kind of discrimination, harassment, mistreatment or bullying towards colleagues, clients, suppliers, stakeholders, shareholders, or any visitors of Criteo. All of this supports us in our mission to power the world’s marketers with trusted and impactful advertising encouraging discovery, innovation and choice in an open internet.

Why Join Us:

At Criteo, we take pride in being a caring culture and are committed to providing our employees with valuable benefits that support their physical, emotional and financial wellbeing, their interests and the important life events. We aim to create a place where people can grow and learn from each other while having a meaningful impact. We want to set you up for success in your job, and an important part of that includes comprehensive perks & benefits. Benefits may vary depending on the country where you work and the nature of your employment with Criteo. When determining compensation, we carefully consider a wide range of job-related factors, including experience, knowledge, skills, education, and location. These factors can cause your compensation to vary.

Title: Data Analyst - (Alemán imprescindible)
Description:
Descripción del puesto: Introducción

Nuestro #teamlidl es competitivo y muy dinámico. Para saber más sobre cómo es trabajar en Lidl consulta nuestra página web de empleo: https://empleo.lidl.es/

Tus tareas
Analizar los datos inmobiliarios de Lidl ES para apoyar a la Dirección en la toma de decisiones estratégicas
Elaborar informes dinámicos de carácter estratégico
Participar y liderar proyectos junto a Lidl INT
Key User de varios sistemas informáticos del área de Inmuebles
Generar herramientas para asegurar la calidad de datos del departamento
Elaborar y coordinar bases de datos
Implantar y mantener los procesos del área
Tu perfil
Estudios Universitarios finalizados
Nivel medio/alto de alemán (escrito y hablado)
Dominio del paquete Office (Excel imprescindible)
Experiencia en programación VBA, Power BI.
Capacidad de organización, trabajo en equipo y orientación al detalle

Se valorará:

Nivel medio/alto de inglés (escrito y hablado)
Conocimientos de lenguaje de programación R
Qué te ofrecemos
Te facilitamos formación teórico-práctica adaptada a tu puesto de trabajo, para que seas capaz de enfrentar cada reto con éxito.
Garantizamos desde el inicio del proceso de selección que éste se desarrollará en base a criterios objetivos. La preocupación por eliminar la brecha de género, así como cualquier otro tipo de discriminación alcanza también a nuestra política salarial, en la que rige el principio de equidad retributiva ante el desempeño de las mismas funciones.
Y un equipo como no te imaginas.

¿Quieres formar parte de una empresa y un equipo en expansión? ¡Inscríbete! Al inscribirte en nuestra oferta de empleo estas aceptando nuestros términos de uso para nuestro portal de empleo. Para más información puedes consultar nuestra página web de empleo: https://empleo.lidl.es/

Title: Senior Data Analyst
Description:
Company Overview: Join a dynamic team where data drives every decision, and innovation shapes the future. We are seeking a seasoned data professional who thrives in a fast-paced environment, dedicated to enhancing operational transparency and precision. If you are passionate about leveraging data to drive business success, this is the role for you. About the Role: As a Senior Data & Operations Analyst, you will be at the forefront of our data management and operational control efforts. You will combine your analytical acumen with strategic vision to optimize processes, ensuring that our data is not only accurate but also actionable. Your expertise will be pivotal in refining our production and sales controlling processes, thereby enabling informed decision-making across all levels of the organization. We need someone between 5 to 10 years of experience who can: - Create and maintain dashboards and reporting tools to provide real-time visibility into operational performance. - Analyze key performance indicators (KPIs) to ensure operational efficiency. - Prepare detailed reports on production and sales performance. - Identify and implement process improvements - Work closely with production, sales, management and the finance team to gather necessary data and insights

Key Responsibilities

Data Management & Process Optimization:

Lead initiatives to refine processes, enhancing operational efficiency and ensuring data integrity.

Guarantee the accuracy of data sourced from various channels, ensuring reliable insights.

Develop and maintain advanced dashboards and reporting tools to offer real-time insights into operational metrics.

Stay updated with the latest industry trends and technological advancements to continuously improve data analysis and control methodologies.

Operational Control & Analysis

Design and implement robust production and sales controlling processes that align with our strategic goals.

Track and analyze critical KPIs to ensure operations run efficiently and meet performance benchmarks.

Prepare comprehensive reports on production and sales metrics, pinpointing trends and identifying opportunities for improvement.

Financial Planning & Strategic Analysis

Lead the forecasting and financial planning efforts, ensuring accuracy and alignment with business objectives.

Conduct detailed variance analyses, comparing actual results against forecasts to highlight discrepancies and opportunities.

Provide senior management with actionable insights and strategic recommendations based on data analysis.

Cross-Functional Collaboration & Communication

Collaborate closely with production, sales, finance, and management teams to collect and analyze necessary data.

Effectively communicate analytical findings and strategic recommendations to stakeholders across all levels of the organization.

Who You Are

A data-driven professional with a passion for accuracy and transparency.

Strong analytical thinker with the ability to balance strategic goals with operational realities.

Technologically adept, with experience in the latest data management and analysis tools.

An excellent communicator who can distill complex data into clear, actionable insights for diverse audiences.

If you are ready to take on a challenging role where your skills in data and operational control will be fully utilized, apply now!

Title: Data Science - Mathematical Optimization Engineer
Description:
¡Hola!

Desde ToBeIT estamos buscando un perfil Senior Data Science - Mathematical Optimization Engineer para trabajar en uno de nuestros principales clientes líder en el sector aeronáutico y cuyas oficinas están en Viladecans.


Misión del puesto:



Este perfil trabajará en desarrollar productos usando modelos basados en optimización matemática que ayudarán a distintas unidades de negocio (Network, Crew, Maintenance, OCC, Ground handling) durante el proceso de decision-making. Esto incluye no solamente el desarrollo de los modelos, sino también mantener el producto en producción y hacer evolutivos frecuentemente. Habrá mucha colaboración entre Data Scientists y Data Engineers and IT Team para poder tener la solución dentro de un producto vivo.


Funciones principales:



Participación en sesiones con los usuarios de la unidad de negocio para entender los requerimientos y limitaciones reales.

Proponer soluciones basadas en optimización matemática que cumplan las necesidades de los usuarios.

Probar varias formulaciones con el objetivo de encontrar la mejor.

Encajar el modelo dentro de un producto y llegar a tenerlo en producción para el uso real.

Estar en el continuo contacto con los usuarios para introducir posibles cambios o ajustes.


Requisitos mínimos:



Conocimiento de fundamentos de optimización lineal y aplicaciones en problemas con variables enteras y binarias

Dos años de experiencia de modelización, resolución y mantenimiento de problemas de optimización

Dominio de Python y librería pandas y programación orientada a objetos.

Experiencia con solvers comerciales: CPLEX, Gurobi…

Conocimiento en queries y procesos de ETL

Experiencia con proyectos de Cloud

Inglés medio
